meanings.definition: Assume a posture or pose to impress others.
meanings.sent1: She attitudinizes in front of the mirror, trying to look confident.
meanings.sent2: He always attitudinizes when he meets new people, trying to appear important.
meanings.sent3: The cat attitudinizes by puffing up its fur to scare away the birds.
meanings.sent4: The politician attitudinizes during the speech, pretending to care about the issues.
meanings.sent5: The actor attitudinizes on stage, striking dramatic poses to captivate the audience.

meanings.definition: Behave in an affected or theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: She attitudinizes by speaking in a fake accent to sound sophisticated.
meanings.sent2: He attitudinizes by constantly complaining about trivial things to get attention.
meanings.sent3: The child attitudinizes by pretending to be a superhero and saving imaginary cities.
meanings.sent4: The teenager attitudinizes by rolling their eyes dramatically whenever asked to do chores.
meanings.sent5: The boss attitudinizes by making grand gestures and speeches to motivate the team.
